Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Reading practices
ContentDescription: In this area of study students consider how language, structure and stylistic choices are used in different literary forms and types of text.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Reading practices
Elaboration: They consider both print and non-print texts, reflecting on the contribution of form and style to meaning.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Reading practices
Elaboration: Students reflect on the degree to which points of view, experiences and contexts shape their own and others’ interpretations of text.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Reading practices
ContentDescription: Students closely examine the literary forms, features and language of texts.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Reading practices
Elaboration: They begin to identify and explore textual details, including language and features, to develop a close analysis response to a text.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Reading practices
ContentDescription: On completion of this unit the student should be able to respond to a range of texts through close analysis.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Reading practices
ContentDescription: To achieve this outcome the student will draw on key knowledge and key skills outlined in Area of Study 1.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentDescription: In this area of study students explore the concerns, ideas, style and conventions common to a distinctive type of literature seen in literary movements or genres.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
Elaboration: Examples of these groupings include literary movements and/or genres such as modernism, epic, tragedy and magic realism, as well as more popular, or mainstream, genres and subgenres such as crime, romance and science fiction.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
Elaboration: Students explore texts from the selected movement or genre, identifying and examining attributes, patterns and similarities that locate each text within that grouping.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
Elaboration: Students engage with the ideas and concerns shared by the texts through language, settings, narrative structures and characterisation, and they experiment with the assumptions and representations embedded in the texts.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentDescription: Students must study at least one complete text alongside multiple samples of other texts from the selected movement or genre.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentDescription: On completion of this unit the student should be able to explore conventions common to a selected movement or genre, and engage with the ideas, concerns and representations from at least one complete text alongside multiple samples of other texts considered characteristic of the selected movement or genre.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentDescription: To achieve this outcome the student will draw on key knowledge and key skills outlined in Area of Study 2.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentDescription: Demonstration of achievement of Unit 1 Outcomes 1 and 2 must be based on at least two complete texts and at least one additional text or excerpts.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentHeader: Exploration of literary movements and genres
ContentDescription: At least one assessment task in either Unit 1 or 2 must include the language modes of speaking and listening; the presentation mode is a school-based decision.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Voices of Country
ContentDescription: In this area of study students explore the voices, perspectives and knowledge of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and creators.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Voices of Country
Elaboration: They consider the interconnectedness of place, culture and identity through the experiences, texts and voices of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, including connections to Country, the impact of colonisation and its ongoing consequences, and issues of reconciliation and reclamation.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Voices of Country
ContentDescription: Students examine representations of culture and identity in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples’ texts and the ways in which these texts present voices and perspectives that explore and challenge assumptions and stereotypes arising from colonisation.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Voices of Country
ContentDescription: Students acknowledge and reflect on a range of Australian views and values (including their own) through a text(s).

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Voices of Country
Elaboration: Within that exploration, students consider stories about the Australian landscape and culture.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Voices of Country
ContentDescription: On completion of this unit the student should be able to explore and reflect on the voices, perspectives and knowledge in the texts of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander authors and creators.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Voices of Country
ContentDescription: To achieve this outcome the student will draw on key knowledge and key skills outlined in Area of Study 1.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: In this area of study students focus on the text and its historical, social and cultural context.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
Elaboration: Students reflect on representations of a specific time period and/or culture within a text.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: Students explore the text to understand its point of view and what it reflects or comments on.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
Elaboration: They identify the language and the representations in the text that reflect the specific time period and/or culture, its ideas and concepts.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
Elaboration: Students develop an understanding that contextual meaning is already implicitly or explicitly inscribed in a text and that textual details and structures can be scrutinised to illustrate its significance.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: Students develop the ability to analyse language closely, recognising that words have historical and cultural import.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: On completion of this unit the student should be able to analyse and respond to the representation of a specific time period and/or culture explored in a text and reflect or comment on the ideas and concerns of individuals and groups in that context.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: To achieve this outcome the student will draw on key knowledge and key skills outlined in Area of Study 2.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: At least one assessment task in either Unit 1 or 2 must include the language modes of speaking and listening; the presentation mode is a school-based decision.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: In Units 3 and 4 students must study at least six texts (including an adapted text).

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
Elaboration: The selection of texts should ensure that students experience a range of literature, from early to contemporary works, dealing with a diversity of cultural experiences and a range of points of view.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
Elaboration: Students are encouraged to read widely, guided by classroom exploration and their own interests, to support the achievement of all outcomes.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: No text or part of a text studied in Units 1 and 2 may be studied again in Units 3 and 4.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: Five texts must be selected from the VCE Literature Text List published by the VCAA for the year of study.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
Elaboration: All five texts selected from the text list must feature in teaching and learning programs, but students may be formally assessed on only four of these texts.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: The selection of five texts must include:

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: At least one of the texts selected must be Australian.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: Students study a sixth text for Unit 3 Area of Study 1.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
Elaboration: The text used for Unit 3 Area of Study 1 must be an adaptation of one of the five required texts selected from the text list published by the VCAA.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: The text may include but is not limited to a:

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: A student adaptation cannot be used as the adaptation text for Unit 3 Area of Study 1.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: Supplementary readings studied for Unit 3 Area of Study 2 are not prescribed.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - The text in its context
ContentDescription: In assessing levels of achievement across Units 3 and 4, teachers must ensure that the assessment tasks are based on a least five texts (including the adapted text).

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Adaptations and transformations
ContentDescription: In this area of study students focus on how the form of a text contributes to its meaning.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Adaptations and transformations
Elaboration: Students explore the form of a set text by constructing a close analysis of that text.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Adaptations and transformations
Elaboration: They then reflect on the extent to which adapting the text to a different form, and often in a new or reimagined context, affects its meaning, comparing the original with the adaptation.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Adaptations and transformations
Elaboration: By exploring an adaptation, students also consider how creators of adaptations may emphasise or minimise viewpoints, assumptions and ideas present in the original text.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Adaptations and transformations
ContentDescription: On completion of this unit the student should be able to analyse aspects of a text, drawing on close analysis of textual detail, and then discuss the extent to which meaning changes when that text is adapted to a different form.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Adaptations and transformations
ContentDescription: To achieve this outcome the student will draw on key knowledge and key skills outlined in Area of Study 1.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Developing interpretations
ContentDescription: In this area of study students explore the different ways we can read and understand a text by developing, considering and comparing interpretations of a set text.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Developing interpretations
ContentDescription: Students first develop their own interpretations of a set text, analysing how ideas, views and values are presented in a text, and the ways these are endorsed, challenged and/or marginalised through literary forms, features and language.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Developing interpretations
Elaboration: These student interpretations should consider the historical, social and cultural context in which a text is written and set.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Developing interpretations
Elaboration: Students also consider their own views and values as readers.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Developing interpretations
ContentDescription: On completion of this unit the student should be able to develop interpretations of a set text informed by the ideas, views and values of the set text and a supplementary reading.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Developing interpretations
ContentDescription: To achieve this outcome the student will draw on key knowledge and key skills outlined in Area of Study 2.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Developing interpretations
ContentDescription: At least one assessment task in either Unit 3 or 4 must include the language modes of speaking and listening.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
ContentDescription: In this area of study students focus on the imaginative techniques used for creating and recreating a literary work.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
Elaboration: Students use their knowledge of how the meaning of texts can change as context and form change to construct their own creative transformations of texts.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
Elaboration: They learn how authors develop representations of people and places, and they develop an understanding of language, voice, form and structure.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
Elaboration: Students draw inferences from the original text in order to create their own writing.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
Elaboration: In their adaptation of the tone and the style of the original text, students develop an understanding of the views and values explored.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
ContentDescription: Students develop an understanding of the various ways in which authors craft texts.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
Elaboration: They reflect critically on the literary form, features and language of a text, and discuss their own responses as they relate to the text, including the purpose and context of their creations.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
ContentDescription: On completion of this unit the student should be able to respond creatively to a text and comment critically on both the original text and the creative response.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 1 - Creative responses to texts
ContentDescription: To achieve this outcome the student will draw on key knowledge and key skills outlined in Area of Study 1.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Close analysis of texts
ContentDescription: On completion of this unit the student should be able to analyse literary forms, features and language to present a coherent view of a whole text.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Close analysis of texts
ContentDescription: To achieve this outcome the student will draw on key knowledge and key skills outlined in Area of Study 2.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Close analysis of texts
ContentDescription: At least one assessment task in either Unit 3 or 4 must include the language modes of speaking and listening.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Close analysis of texts
ContentDescription: The examination will be set by a panel appointed by the VCAA.

Subject: Literature
AreaofStudy: Area of Study 2 - Close analysis of texts
Elaboration: All the key knowledge and key skills that underpin the outcomes in Units 3 and 4 are examinable.
